page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: The following pages reflect a typical rural area of Staffordshire.This particular block is to be found to the north-east of Stafford.The villages of Weston and Ingestre dominate the area and the only real industry to be found is on the Hixon Industrial Estate. In such a rural area,major buildings such as Ingestre Hall and the Balmoral tend to stand out. Farming is a very important occupation in the area.The Trent and Mersey Canal is an important routeway,along with roads such as the A51. In rural areas certain families tend to dominate the community and this is true of this block eg the Chetwynd family. The church plays an important role in rural community life and Ingestre Church is a fine example of ecclesiastical architecture.
